>I=A0think=A0of=A0the=A0following=A0REST=A0model:
>
>Resources:=A0TestRecip=
e=A0/=A0TestReport
>
>To=A0put=A0a=A0test=A0recipe:
>
>PUT=A0
>http://Roger=
/
>Tests/TestRecipe
>=A0
>with  as XML document. The URI of the test recipe=
 is
>returned.

If you use PUT, the client should PUT to the URI of the tes=
t recipe.=A0 If you want the server to create the new URI, the client shoul=
d POST to a a URI like http://Roger/Tests/TestRecipes, and the server shoul=
d return the URI of the newly created recipe resource in the Location heade=
r.

>
>
>With=A0GET=A0
>http://Roger/
>Tests/TestRecipe
>=A0you=A0will=A0ge=
t=A0all=A0available=A0test recipes.

Sounds good.

>The=A0problem=A0i=A0hav=
e=A0is=A0to=A0run=A0a=A0test=A0recipe.=A0A=A0test=A0recipe=A0can=A0be
>
>
>=
started=A0multiple=A0times.
>
>
>POST=A0
>http://Roger/
>Tests/TestRecipe
>=
/TestRecipe12?
>cmd=3Drun
>
>This=A0will=A0start=A0a=A0test=A0run=A0and=A0t=
he=A0URI=A0of=A0the=A0TestReport=A0is=A0returned.

Avoid using commands/ver=
bs in URIs.=A0 Alternatives include:

POST to http://Roger/Tests/TestRecipe=
/TestRecipe12 (test parameters in POST body)
POST to http://Roger/Tests/Tes=
tRecipe/TestRecipe12/TestRuns (test parameters in POST body)
PUT a new test=
 recipe representation to http://Roger/Tests/TestReceipe/TestRecipe12 that =
includes the parameters for the new test run

>Within=A0the=A0TestReport=A0=
the=A0URI=A0of=A0the=A0corresponding=A0TestRecipe=A0is=A0put.
>
>
>The=A0te=
st=A0results=A0can=A0be=A0viewed=A0by:
>
>
>GET=A0
>http://Roger/
>Tests/Te=
stReport
>/TestReport12
>
>
>However=A0should=A0this=A0last=A0resource=A0be=
=A0created=A0right=A0after=A0creating=A0the
>
>run=A0of=A0the=A0test=A0reci=
pe?=A0The=A0test=A0report=A0is=A0available=A0only=A0after=A0the
>
>
>test=
=A0is=A0ready!
>

You could create a test report resource with a state of "=
running," and possibly an expected completion time.=A0 The resource would c=
hange when the test completes.=A0 Or you could do a "temporary redirect" (3=
07) to a resource the represents incomplete test reports, or you could retu=
rn a "no content" (204) until the test report is available.=A0 Not sure abo=
ut that last one, others on the list might want to chime in.

Good luck,
Ke=
vin Christen

--=_alternative 00531B9C862572CF_=
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
Content-Type: text/html;
	charset=ISO-8859-1

>I think of the following REST model:<br>&=
gt;<br>>Resources: TestRecipe / TestReport<br>><br>&gt=
;To put a test recipe:<br>><br>>PUT <br>>=
http://Roger/<br>>Tests/TestRecipe<br>> <br>>with <testrecipe=
> as XML document. The URI of the test recipe is<br>>returned.<br><br>If=
 you use PUT, the client should PUT to the URI of the test recipe.  If=
 you want the server to create the new URI, the client should POST to a a U=
RI like http://Roger/Tests/TestRecipes, and the server should return the UR=
I of the newly created recipe resource in the Location header.<br><br>><=
br>><br>>With GET <br>>http://Roger/<br>>Tests/TestRe=
cipe<br>> you will get all available test =
recipes.<br><br>Sounds good.<br><br>>The problem i have&n=
bsp;is to run a test recipe. A test&nbsp=
;recipe can be<br>><br>><br>>started multiple =
times.<br>><br>><br>>POST <br>>http://Roger/<br>>Tests/=
TestRecipe<br>>/TestRecipe12?<br>>cmd=3Drun<br>><br>>This =
will start a test run and the URI o=
f the TestReport is returned.<br><br>Avoid using comman=
ds/verbs in URIs.  Alternatives include:<br><br>POST to http://Roger/T=
ests/TestRecipe/TestRecipe12 (test parameters in POST body)<br>POST to http=
://Roger/Tests/TestRecipe/TestRecipe12/TestRuns (test parameters in POST bo=
dy)<br>PUT a new test recipe representation to http://Roger/Tests/TestRecei=
pe/TestRecipe12 that includes the parameters for the new test run<br><br>&g=
t;Within the TestReport the URI of the c=
orresponding TestRecipe is put.<br>><br>><br>>The&n=
bsp;test results can be viewed by:<br>><br>>=
<br>>GET <br>>http://Roger/<br>>Tests/TestReport<br>>/Test=
Report12<br>><br>><br>>However should this last&nbs=
p;resource be created right after creating th=
e<br>><br>>run of the test recipe? The =
test report is available only after the<br>&g=
t;<br>><br>>test is ready!<br>><br><br>You could create =
a test report resource with a state of "running," and possibly an expected =
completion time.  The resource would change when the test completes.&n=
bsp; Or you could do a "temporary redirect" (307) to a resource the represe=
nts incomplete test reports, or you could return a "no content" (204) until=
 the test report is available.  Not sure about that last one, others o=
n the list might want to chime in.<br><br>Good luck,<br>Kevin Christen<br><=
br></testrecipe>
